roleset.name: tell the future
roleset.note: PREDICT-V NOTES: Corresponds to VN class indicate-78. (from predict.01-v)
PREDICTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb predict.01; VN class indicate-78. Framed by Claire (from prediction.01-n)

example.name: prediction as utterance
example.text: He predicted that the board would give the current duo until early next year before naming a new chief executive.
example.arg: that the board would give the current duo until early next year before naming a new chief executive

example.name: prediction as noun phrase
example.text: Analysts were predicting 1990 BellSouth earnings in the range of $3.90 a share, or $1.9 billion, but now those estimates are being scaled back.
example.arg: 1990 BellSouth earnings in the range of $3.90 a share, or $1.9 billion

example.name: Fragment, All arguments
example.text: Analysts ' predictions of about $ 1.4 a share for the quarter...

example.name: Arg1 in preverbal position, sbar modification
example.text: At the meeting , Huang Xiangning read the earthquake prediction that they had previously issued .

example.name: arg1
example.text: I think that the problem here that we 've had right from the beginning is overly optimistic predictions on the part of what would happen if we attacked Iraq /.
example.arg: on the part of what would happen if we attacked Iraq

roleset.name: able to be forecast
roleset.note: PREDICTABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-7. (from predictable.01-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: Meanwhile , the difficulty to pass this by referendum in Taiwan is also predictable . After all , Taiwanese people are accustomed to status quo and are highly dubious about any changes .
example.arg: the difficulty to pass this by referendum in Taiwan
